#### Load the QTL models from "basicQTL" tutorial

```{r get models, include=FALSE}
data(multitrait)
cross<-multitrait
cross<-calc.genoprob(cross)
phes <- c("X3.Hydroxypropyl", "X3.Butenyl", "X3.Methylsulfinylpropyl", "X5.Methylsulfinylpentyl", "X6.Methylthiohexyl", "X4.Benzoyloxybutyl", "Quercetin.deoxyhexosyl.dihexoside")

stepout<-lapply(phes, function(i) {
  stepwiseqtl(cross, pheno.col=i, method="hk", max.qtl=4, 
              additive.only=TRUE, penalties = c(2.5,3.5,1.5), verbose=F)
})
names(stepout)<-phes
models.out<-stepout
```

### Part V: Get model statistics for a single phenotype
```{r}
mod<-models.out[["X3.Methylsulfinylpropyl"]]
qtlStats(cross, pheno.col = "X3.Methylsulfinylpropyl", form = formula(mod), mod = mod)
qtlStats(cross, pheno.col = "X3.Methylsulfinylpropyl", form = "y ~ Q1 + Q2 + Q1*Q2", mod = mod)
```

### Part V: Get model statistics for multiple phenotypes
```{r}
allstats<-lapply(phes, function(i){
  print(i)
  mod<-models.out[[i]]
  qstats<-qtlStats(cross, pheno.col = i, form = formula(mod), mod = mod)
  qstats$pheno<-i
  return(qstats)
})
allstats<-do.call(rbind, allstats)
```

```{r}
lsmeans4qtl(cross, phe = "X3.Methylsulfinylpropyl",form = "y ~ Q1 + Q2 + Q1*Q2", mod = mod, covar=NULL)
```
